title: Rear Suspension Unit - Installation

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle Including locking devices
Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
Note to be used in service manual with stabilise warning
Renew locking devices where specified, refer to
Before tightening a fixing using a crow foot spanner adapter, refer to
Use of Crow Foot Spanner Adapters with Torque Wrenches
Observe all torque wrench tightening procedures, refer to
Remove any old locking agent from the bolts, see
Refit the rear suspension unit to the motorcycle by positioning the unit forwards into the frame aperture .
Align the rear suspension unit upper mounting into the frame.
If not already pre-coated apply 0.5 ml of Loctite dri-lock 204 or equivalent to the threads of the bolt.
Fit the new bolt from the left hand side.
When tightening the upper rear suspension, hold the nut to prevent rotation while tightening the bolt to the specified torque.
Hold the nut to prevent rotation and tighten the bolt to
Locate the rear suspension unit lower mounting.
Make sure the spacer locates fully into the left hand side of the swinging arm.
Fit the spacer into the left hand side of the swinging arm.
If not already pre-coated apply 0.5 ml of Loctite dri-lock 204 or equivalent to the threads of the bolt.
Fit the bolt from the left hand side.
Position the washer over the bolt.
When tightening the lower rear suspension, hold the bolt to prevent rotation while tightening the nut to the specified torque.
With the weight of the motorcycle on its wheels, :
Hold the nut to prevent rotation and tighten the rear suspension unit upper mounting bolt to
Hold the bolt to prevent rotation and tighten the rear suspension unit lower mounting nut to
